brewery.brewery_description:
Brewed with passion in the Itchen Valley, Hampshire.
Our cask ale is brewed by our small team working tirelessly to provide the South of England and further afield with full bodied, tasty ale, to be enjoyed on pump or in the bottle. 
Keep an eye out on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter for the latest on the brewery and to put a face to the beer.

items.checkin_comment: Had this at Guildford Beer Festival in July 2021

beer.beer_description: Truly Hampshire's Rose, constantly popular and ever a staple of our brew plan.

items.badge_description: Whether you’re feeling extra special or extra strong, stopping by the local pub for a delicious Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter is always a good decision! That's 250 different beers with the style of Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter. Try 5 more for Level 51!

beer.beer_description: Truly Hampshire's Rose, constantly popular and ever a staple of our brew plan.

items.checkin_comment: My final bottle 2years past bbe date but still up to the mark

beer.beer_description: Final Tap, created to celebrate the brewing heritage of Itchen Valley Brewery where we have been brewing great beers for nearly a quarter of a century. Using the knowledge gained since 1997 this beer contains no less than six malts and eleven hops, cleverly crafted to create this golden, thirst quenching ale. We hope you enjoy!

user.bio: Wigston Field's top ticker.  Previously on Ratebeer.
Wigston Field's top ticker.  Previously on Ratebeer.

beer.beer_description: Comrades! The war on tasteless beer is raging. Too long have we been oppressed with capitalist lager and stout imposters. This deep dark ale holds pleasing hints of coffee. Rich and powerful (rather like our brewer). In spite of the strong ABV it is all too easy to drink a lot of this, so take care.

user.bio: Wigston Field's top ticker.  Previously on Ratebeer.

beer.beer_description:
One of our original brews, does exactly what it says on the clip – Quality English Draft. A perfectly balanced mid-brown bitter containing three of the finest English hops: First Gold, Fuggles and Goldings. At 4.1% it’s a popular choice for a house ale.
Formerly sold as Fagins.

user.bio: Wigston Field's top ticker.  Previously on Ratebeer.

beer.beer_description: Pure Gold, pure and simple, stronger in ABV and crystal clear for those summer refreshing pints, or whenever you fancy.

user.bio: Wigston Field's top ticker.  Previously on Ratebeer.
Wigston Field's top ticker.  Previously on Ratebeer.

beer.beer_description: Elderflower blooming across a patch of English trees. Bees floating on the warm summer air. The noise of bails exploding in the first game of cricket. We thought of all these in the making of this rather special beer. The hops flavours are full and juicy but the key to Hambledon is the sweetest of New Zealand honey, offset by elderflower, creating one of our most addictively smooth pints. We are very proud of this one

user.bio: Wigston Field's top ticker.  Previously on Ratebeer.

beer.beer_description: Named after the two Godfathers (Simon and Clive) who conceived Itchen Valley at a Christening. This clean and crisp session bitter is as pleasing today as it was after it’s inaugural pint. Golden, gently malty and finely balanced with blends of wheat and Crystal malt and four sumptuous English hops. Our holy water.

user.bio: Wigston Field's top ticker.  Previously on Ratebeer.

beer.beer_description: Boringly named but far from dull to drink we assure you. In the tradition of the season this Santa is abundantly sweet and malty with a fruity presents. A strong and sumptuous winter beer with a mild bitter finish – result – happiness.

items.checkin_comment: Sep '17. Cask conditioned at The Mason's Arms, Headington, Oxford

beer.beer_description: The pride of our brewery and valley! An easy drinking session bitter, full of flavour with a lovely hazel colour that seems to change from every angle.

items.checkin_comment: Jul '18. Cask conditioned at The North Norfolk Railway Beer Festival '18, Sheringham, Norfolk.

beer.beer_description: Light and hoppy. Brewed for world cup 2018

items.checkin_comment: This is a perfect execution of a style that I love. I wish that a US brewer could replicate this magnificence.

user.bio: Trenton, NJ-Would like to connect with people from US, Britain & Europe

beer.beer_description: Back by popular demand, this seasonal beer will now become available throughout the year in limited batches. Brewed with local Alresford watercress which leaves a subtle bitterness to the finish.

user.bio: Pub regular and real ale drinker

items.badge_description: While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 375 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 76!

beer.beer_description:
Diplomatic relations with India have been frosty since we refused to send them some of this. Predominantly hoped with the magnificent high alpha Citra from the US and a balance of German and English malts – this is very much a world-wide beer and Indian only in name. Amazing atomas and, of course, hoppy as you like.
NOTE: Label art and ABV may have changed since this beer was originally brewed.
